§AUDIOPATH[

]AUDIOPATH§
§PARTS[
§
]PARTS§
§TOOLS[
§
]TOOLS§
§TEXTFIELDS[
§Application Settings: Camera
§10
]TEXTFIELDS§
§TAGS[
§webcam settings; webcam options; camera settings; camera options
]TAGS§
§ANNODRAFT[
§
]ANNODRAFT§
§ANNOFINAL[
§<html dir="ltr"><head></head><body contenteditable="true"><p><font face="Segoe UI">The <b>Camera Tab (2)</b> of the Application Settings contains:</font></p><p></p><ul><li><font face="Segoe UI">The <b>Select (3)&nbsp;</b>button to set&nbsp;the webcam used for documentation, which opens a dialog with a dropdown list of all available webcams <b>(4)</b>. The name of the camera is displayed in the label underneath the&nbsp;button <b>(3)</b>.<br><br></font></li><li><font face="Segoe UI">A button to set the camera's resolution <b>(5)</b>&nbsp;and a text label which displays the currently selected resolution (here: 1280x720)<br><br></font></li><li><font face="Segoe UI">The <b>Rotate Image</b> <b>(6)</b> button to rotate the image of the webcam by multiples of 90°, to enable adapting to different camera mounts.&nbsp;</font>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</li></ul><table cellspacing="0" border="0"><colgroup width="19"></colgroup><colgroup width="38"></colgroup><colgroup width="9"></colgroup><colgroup width="86"></colgroup><colgroup width="286"></colgroup><colgroup width="19"></colgroup><tbody><tr><td style="border-top: 1px solid #b2b2b2; border-left: 1px solid #b2b2b2" height="9" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #b2b2b2; border-right: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td></tr><tr><td style="border-left: 1px solid #b2b2b2" height="38" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #cccccc; border-bottom: 1px solid #cccccc; border-left: 1px solid #cccccc" align="center" valign="bottom"><font size="1"><img style="display:block;" src="plpictogrampathpl/M001_General_Mandatory.png" alt="image not found" width="40px"></font></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #cccccc; border-bottom: 1px solid #cccccc" align="center" valign="middle"><font size="1"><br></font></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #cccccc; border-bottom: 1px solid #cccccc; border-right: 1px solid #cccccc" colspan="2" align="left" valign="bottom"><b><font size="4">NOTICE</font></b></td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td></tr><tr><td style="border-left: 1px solid #b2b2b2" height="6" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><font size="1"><br></font></td><td align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><font size="1"><br></font></td><td align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><font size="1"><br></font></td><td align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><font size="1"><br></font></td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td></tr><tr><td style="border-left: 1px solid #b2b2b2" height="17" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td align="left" valign="top" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><b><font size="1"><br></font></b></td><td style="border-top: 1px solid #cccccc; border-bottom: 1px solid #cccccc; border-left: 1px solid #cccccc; border-right: 1px solid #cccccc" colspan="3" align="left" valign="top" bgcolor="#FFFFFF"><ul><li>The resolutions presented in the Camera Resolution settings are not necessarily supported by your webcam. The webcam API used in ManuMaker does not yet support querying the webcam&nbsp;for supported resolutions at HD level. &nbsp;<br><br></li><li>This appears to be a safe-failing feature, as all tested cameras defaulted to standard VGA resolution when an unsupported &nbsp;resolution was selected.&nbsp;<br><br></li><li>If you select a high resolution and the camera doesn't seem to have adopted it, the likely cause is that the selected resolution is not supported.&nbsp;</li></ul></td><td style="border-right: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td></tr><tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #b2b2b2; border-left: 1px solid #b2b2b2" height="9" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid #b2b2b2; border-right: 1px solid #b2b2b2" align="left" bgcolor="#EEEEEE"><br></td></tr></tbody></table><p></p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</body></html>&nbsp;&nbsp;
]ANNOFINAL§
